00040 char nToChar(int n, bool upperCase) {
00041     if (n < 10) return char(n+'0');
00042     else if (upperCase) return char((n - 10) + 'A');
00043     else return char((n - 10) + 'a');
00044 }
00045 
00046 } // namespace
00047 
00069 std::string to_string(const integer& n, size_t base, bool uppercase) {
00070     if (n.is_nan()) return detail::nan_text;
00071     if (base<2 || base>36) {
00072         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw invalid_base();
00073         else return std::string();
00074     }
00075 
00076     if (n.sign()==0) return "0";
00077 
00078     std::ostringstream out;
00079     if (base==16) {
00080         // Special no-division version, primarily for debugging division
00081         const data_t *ndata=n._get_data();
00082         const digit_t *firstDigit=ndata->digits,
00083             *lastDigit=firstDigit + ndata->mLength - 1;
00084 
00085         const int bitsPerDigit=4;
00086         const digit_t mask=(doubledigit_t(1) << bitsPerDigit)-1;
00087 
00088         // Suppress any leading zeros
00089         const digit_t *d=lastDigit;
00090         int digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bitsPerDigit);
00091         while (digitShift >= 0 && ((*d >> digitShift) & mask) == 0)
00092             digitShift -= bitsPerDigit;
00093 
00094         do {
00095             while (digitShift >= 0) {
00096                 out << nToChar((*d >> digitShift) & mask, uppercase);
00097                 digitShift -= bitsPerDigit;
00098             }
00099 
00100             digitShift=(bits_per_digit - bitsPerDigit);
00101         } while (d-- != firstDigit);
00102 
00103         std::string r(n.sign() < 0 ? std::string("-")+out.str() : out.str());
00104         return r;
00105     } else {
00106         const integer shift=base;
00107         std::pair<integer, integer> a=std::make_pair(n, integer::zero());
00108         a.first._set_negative(false);
00109 
00110         integer r;
00111         while (a.first.sign()!=0) {
00112             a=divide_r(a.first, shift);
00113             out << nToChar(a.second._get_digit(0), uppercase);
00114         }
00115 
00116         if (n.sign() < 0) out << '-';
00117 
00118         std::string rval=out.str();
00119         std::reverse(rval.begin(), rval.end());
00120         return rval;
00121     }
00122 }

00150 integer from_string(const std::string& str, size_t base) {
00151     if (str==detail::nan_text) return integer(not_a_number());
00152 
00153     bool negate=false;
00154     const char *c=str.c_str();
00155     if (*c=='+') ++c;
00156     else if (*c=='-') { negate=true; ++c; }
00157 
00158     if (base==autobase) {
00159         if (*c=='0') {
00160             ++c;
00161             if (*c=='x' || *c=='X') {
00162                 ++c;
00163                 base=16;
00164             } else base=8;
00165         } else base=10;
00166     }
00167 
00168     if (base<2 || base>36) {
00169         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw invalid_base();
00170         else return integer(not_a_number());
00171     }
00172 
00173     if (*c==0) {
00174         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw invalid_digit("No valid digits");
00175         else return integer(not_a_number());
00176     }
00177 
00178     const integer shift(base);
00179 
00180     integer r;
00181     while (*c) {
00182         unsigned int digit;
00183         if (*c>='0' && *c<='9') digit=*c-'0';
00184         else if (*c>='A' && *c<='Z') digit=*c-'A'+10;
00185         else if (*c>='a' && *c<='z') digit=*c-'a'+10;
00186         else {
00187             if (exceptions_allowed()) throw invalid_digit("encountered non-alphanumeric character in string");
00188             else return integer(not_a_number());
00189         }
00190 
00191         if (digit >= base) {
00192             if (exceptions_allowed()) throw invalid_digit("encountered digit greater than base allows");
00193             else return integer(not_a_number());
00194         }
00195 
00196         r = (r * shift) + digit;
00197         ++c;
00198     }
00199     r._set_negative(negate);
00200     return r;
00201 }

00212 integer from_binary(const std::string& str) {
00213     const size_t bytesPerDigit=sizeof(digit_t);
00214     const size_t bitsPerByte=std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00215 
00216     integer r;
00217     detail::data_t *rdata=r._get_data();
00218     rdata->alloc((str.length() + bytesPerDigit - 1)/bytesPerDigit);
00219     digit_t *p=rdata->digits;
00220 
00221     unsigned char *s=(unsigned char *)str.data(), *se=s+str.length();
00222     while (s<se) {
00223         digit_t d=0;
00224         for (size_t i=0; i<bytesPerDigit && s<se; ++i)
00225             d |= (digit_t(*s++) << (i * bitsPerByte));
00226         *p++=d;
00227     }
00228     rdata->skipLeadingZeros();
00229     return r;
00230 }
00231 
00248 std::string to_binary(const integer& n) {
00249     n._throw_if_nan();
00250 
00251     const size_t bytesPerDigit=sizeof(digit_t);
00252     const size_t bitsPerByte=std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::digits;
00253     std::vector<unsigned char> temp;
00254     temp.reserve(n._get_length() * bytesPerDigit);
00255 
00256     const detail::data_t *ndata=n._get_data();
00257     const digit_t *p=ndata->digits, *pe=p+n._get_length();
00258     while (p != pe) {
00259         digit_t d(*p++);
00260         for (size_t i=0; i<bytesPerDigit; ++i) {
00261             temp.push_back((unsigned char)(d));
00262             d >>= bitsPerByte;
00263         }
00264     }
00265     while (!temp.empty() && temp.back()==0) temp.pop_back();
00266     char *c=(char*)&temp[0];
00267     return std::string(c, c+temp.size());
00268 }
